name: jerkily
content:

in a way that is not smooth and pleasant, but has quick and sudden movements: He began to dance jerkily. The car rolled jerkily to a halt. See
jerky
More examplesFewer examplesThey moved jerkily, as if they were puppets on the end of strings.He drove a little jerkily until he got more used to the car.She sank to the floor, crying jerkily.I walked jerkily around the park, shivering.
